issues.description: The template repository’s Meal.java defines class Order instead of class Meal (and there’s also a duplicate Order.java), yet the problem statement specifies a Meal class and the solution implements Meal. As a result, there’s no Meal class in the template, causing compilation failures and confusion about which class to use.
issues.suggested_fix: In the template, rename and update Meal.java to define public class Meal (with the appropriate constructor and getters), remove or repurpose the duplicate Order.java (or delete it if unused), and update Main to reference Meal instead of Order, aligning with the problem statement and solution.

issues.description: The problem statement and solution refer to a class named 'Meal' to represent a meal with ingredients, but the template repository defines this concept as a class named 'Order'. This conflates the concepts of a meal and an order and will confuse students when mapping the requirements to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the 'Order' class in the template to 'Meal' (and update the file name to Meal.java), and update all references to use 'Meal' so that class names align across the problem statement, template, and solution.
